metadata.feature_description: Configure pagination size for content lists across social modules with options from 5 to 100 items per page.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify dropdown shows all available options

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Settings > Community Settings
steps.expected: Community Settings panel opens with Page Size section visible
steps.actual: Community Settings panel opened successfully showing Miscellaneous Community Settings with Page Size dropdown

steps.action: Click on Page Size dropdown to view all options
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed all 6 options: 5 items, 10 items, 15 items, 25 items, 50 items, 100 items

steps.action: Select '5 items' from the Page Size dropdown
steps.actual: 5 items was successfully selected in the dropdown

steps.expected: Settings should be saved with success message
steps.actual: Success message 'Item successfully saved.' appeared confirming the save

steps.action: Select '100 items' from the Page Size dropdown
steps.actual: 100 items was successfully selected in the dropdown

steps.expected: Settings should be saved with success message
steps.actual: Success message 'Item successfully saved.' appeared confirming the save

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save page size and verify persistence

steps.action: Reload the page and navigate back to Community Settings
steps.expected: Page should reload and Community Settings should be accessible
steps.actual: Page reloaded successfully and Community Settings panel was accessible

steps.action: Verify Page Size value after reload
steps.expected: Page Size should still show '100 items' (the last saved value)
steps.actual: Page Size dropdown showed '100 items' [selected], confirming persistence

observations: The Page Size dropdown provides 6 options: 5, 10, 15, 25, 50, and 100 items per page
The current installation shows a default value of 10 items (not 5 as documented for new installations)
Save operation provides immediate visual feedback with 'Item successfully saved.' notification
Settings persist correctly across page reloads, confirming backend storage is working properly
The Comments Page Size is a separate setting from the Content Page Size
